results.title: High jump and pole vault
results.creator_credit: Department of Education, Queensland and Ron Taylor
results.brief_description: Shows American high jumper Nat Page, demonstrating his own style of the Fosbury flop. Presents the warm up routines, techniques and drills required for progression towards the complete skills.

results.title: High Jump
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching tips for high jump events from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of high jump events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: High jump
results.creator_credit: United World Films, United States Olympic Association, Edmund Dorfmann and Harold Young
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
Instructional film which takes us through an in-depth examination of high jump technique. Use of slow-motion and still camerawork of champion high-jumpers allows detailed explanation of correct running approach, the proper method of lifting and rolling at the bar and correct landing. Some common faults are pointed out and advice is given on how best to achieve optimal performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United World Films, United States Olympic Association, Edmund Dorfmann and Harold Young

results.title: High jump
results.creator_credit: Ryan Films and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The techniques and steps to successful performance in the highjump event. Shows the two main principles in high jumping, illustrated with diagrams, maximising lift in practice, pointing out faults in the style of the athlete; clearing the bar by the “role” method in which the body rotates over the bar; preparatory training exercises for athletes and training procedure being practised under the direction of a coach.

results.title: High Hopes
results.brief_description: Lyn and Patrice leave school with definite plans for their careers. Following long periods unemployed they reassess their aspirations and finally accept jobs they didn’t really want.

results.title: High hopes
results.creator_credit: Portman Film, Simon Channing-Williams and Mike Leigh
results.brief_description: Winner of the International Critics Award, Mike Leigh’s tragi-comedy depicts Great Britain as a divided serfdom. One half of the population is in thrall to Dayglo dreams of social ascent, the other half to dissent and wistful radicalism. In converted slum-lands, yuppies live side by side with the last surviving council tenants, and in stubborn bedsits, the last surviving Marxists hold out, growing unwashed beards with the devotion of scientists. The film’s triumph is the depiction, at once satirical and compassionate, of its two aging Marxists, two lost souls like you and me, who soldier on with their small lives while the large world outside moves inevitably towards eternity or Armageddon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Portman Film, Simon Channing-Williams and Mike Leigh

results.title: High heels
results.creator_credit: Victorian Women's Film Unit and Sue Brooks
results.brief_description: In the 1980’s high heels are back in fashion and women are back in high heels. Why is it feminine to walk in high heels? What does it do to your spine? Does a woman who is helpless need help? What is the appeal of restrictive fashion? And in what way do high heels restrict us? Why do women wear high heels? Written by Alison Tilson.

results.title: High Ground
results.brief_description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.

results.title: High grass circus
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low, Torben Schioler and Tony Ianzelo
results.brief_description: A ticket to entertainment at the Royal Brothers’ Circus - the only Canadian tent circus in Canada. Filmed during a hectic summer season, with the Big Top up, in transit, or being erected, it vividly captures the 24-hour-a-day brand of circus magic and observes both the men and mechanics behind it. Like the circus itself, it hovers between comedy, sentimentality and the grotesque. An abridged version entitled ‘Little Big Top’ is also available. (Awards: Yorkton, Los Angeles)

results.title: High frequency heating
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: Explains heating by induction and dielectric heating. The film illustrates how this heating effect is used in industry and medicine.
